title: Philosophy of Training
content: Increased performance is based on neural adaptation (sale, 1986) Neural adaptation is accomplished by shortening [MU] motor unit recruitment and activationTeach CNS to react to stimuli accordingly-better intramuscular coordinationImprove intermuscular coordination – teach agonistic and antagonistic muscles to cooperate.Train fast and specific – in order to perform quickly and explosively Therefore recruitment of MU at highest rate of contraction is important and this can be achieved by using as many movement as possible involved in the game.

title: Powered by MDX
content: You can write JSX and use React components within your Markdown thanks to MDX. Docusaurus green and Facebook blue are my favorite colors. I can write Markdown alongside my JSX!

title: Introduction
content: Peak performance is a state of superior functioning that characterizes sporting performance resulting in a player's personal bests and outstanding achievements. Besides a player's mental strength—the ability to adjust to situations and solve problems—the athlete's level of conditioning plays a great role in helping him to reach their peak performance regularly. Conditioning is the sum of all physical factors affecting performance. Conditioning can be broken down to the various elements such as: endurancespeedpowermobilitycoordination The better trained each element is, the closer the athlete will get to optimum performance. One of the contributing factors for improving performance is motor fitness—agility, power, quickness, and speed.

title: Agility Drills
content: Basic Agility 1 Purpose: To build reaction time, change direction, explosiveness in the hips, abdominals, lower back, quadriceps, hamstrings. ![Basic Agility 1 (old)](../.gitbook/assets/image (33).png) Procedure: Use one-and-a-half court sStart at WAt the coach’s signal sprint out fast toward XRotate hip and make sure that one foot crosses XSprint as fast as possible toward Y, rotate hips and make sure that one foot crosses YSprint toward Z and run through Basic Agility 2 Purpose: To build reaction time, change direction, explosiveness in the hips, abdominals, lower back, quadriceps, hamstrings. ![Basic Agility 2 (old)](../.gitbook/assets/image (13).png) Use one-and-a-half courtsStart at AAt the coach’s signal sprint cut as fast toward B, C, D, E, F, **and finish at G**Sprint towards G and run through

title: Conclusion
content: Conclusion The exercises suggested in this booklet need to be modified according to needs. These exercises have been suggested to clarify the concept of motor fitness training. There are numerous exercises the coach can create to improve the motor fitness of the players. While designing exercises coaches must consider recovery, quality of effort, individual ability and the effect of the exercise on the player. Finally, for all court work: shadow. Multifeeding, specific pattern drills and match play is agility.

content: Begin by doing 21: PushupsBall SlamsSplit Lunges ↻ Repeat but 15 times, then 9 times 50x Toe Taps on ledge1x Sprint (Speed bump to speed bump) ↻ Repeat but 40 toe taps, then 30, 20, 10

title: Badminton Movement and Motor Fitness
content: Badminton movement consists of short burst of speed. Therefore it is anaerobic based.The movements are lateral and vertical. Strengthening the lower body is vital, especially the ankles, knees and hips. All three extensions must produce explosive movements.Badminton movement consists of a lot of hip flips. This means a lot of work must be done on the core-abdomen and lower back.Agility is conducting dynamic movement in small area. Quickness is reaction time and explosive speed.Explosiveness is essential especially in defence.Agility and quickness are neuromuscular skills that help increase adaptability, explosive acceleration, deceleration and precision with which players can handle their own bodies facilitating smooth coordination between the body position, footwork, racket control while reacting to constant and rapid changes in playing situation.Being able to combine quickness and agility is most important in badminton.Quickness and agility training consist of quality, not quantity.The best way to improve quickness and agility is through plyometrics.In plyometrics, muscles serve with a memory, memorizing the time it takes for your muscle to lengthen and shorten. The muscle store elastic energy between the two actions and cause explosiveness. By repeating the exercises, the muscles will perfect the action.

title: Style Guide
content: You can write content using GitHub-flavored Markdown syntax. Markdown Syntax To serve as an example page when styling markdown based Docusaurus sites. Headers H1 - Create the best documentation H2 - Create the best documentation H3 - Create the best documentation H4 - Create the best documentation H5 - Create the best documentation H6 - Create the best documentation Emphasis Emphasis, aka italics, with asterisks or underscores. Strong emphasis, aka bold, with asterisks or underscores. Combined emphasis with asterisks and underscores. Strikethrough uses two tildes. Scratch this. Lists First ordered list itemAnother item Unordered sub-list. Actual numbers don't matter, just that it's a number Ordered sub-list And another item. Unordered list can use asterisks Or minuses Or pluses Links I'm an inline-style link I'm an inline-style link with title I'm a reference-style link You can use numbers for reference-style link definitions Or leave it empty and use the link text itself. URLs and URLs in angle brackets will automatically get turned into links. http://www.example.com/ or http://www.example.com/ and sometimes example.com (but not on GitHub, for example). Some text to show that the reference links can follow later. Images Here's our logo (hover to see the title text): Inline-style: Reference-style: Images from any folder can be used by providing path to file. Path should be relative to markdown file. Code var s = 'JavaScript syntax highlighting'; alert(s); s = "Python syntax highlighting" print(s) No language indicated, so no syntax highlighting. But let's throw in a tag. function highlightMe() { console.log('This line can be highlighted!'); } Tables Colons can be used to align columns. Tables Are Coolcol 3 is right-aligned \$1600 col 2 is centered \$12 zebra stripes are neat \$1 There must be at least 3 dashes separating each header cell. The outer pipes (|) are optional, and you don't need to make the raw Markdown line up prettily. You can also use inline Markdown. Markdown Less PrettyStill renders nicely 1 2 3 Blockquotes Blockquotes are very handy in email to emulate reply text. This line is part of the same quote. Quote break. This is a very long line that will still be quoted properly when it wraps. Oh boy let's keep writing to make sure this is long enough to actually wrap for everyone. Oh, you can putMarkdown into a blockquote. Inline HTML Definition list Is something people use sometimes. Markdown in HTML Does *not* work **very** well. Use HTML tags. Line Breaks Here's a line for us to start with. This line is separated from the one above by two newlines, so it will be a separate paragraph. This line is also a separate paragraph, but... This line is only separated by a single newline, so it's a separate line in the same paragraph. Admonitions note This is a note tip This is a tip important This is important caution This is a caution warning This is a warning

Rowing machine21x Burpee Push-ups21x Push-ups21x Hamstring Curls21x Frog Jumps21x Air Squats21x Split LungesRun – 21 4 Minute Core [3 sets]: 21x Crunches21x ‘V’ Sit-ups21x Leg Raises
